result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Lee Beckman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Douglas Lee Beckman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Douglas Lee Beckman was found guilty of Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Douglas Lee Beckman was found guilty of Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Douglas Lee Beckman was found guilty of Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent.  DEFENDANT TO RECEIVE 2 DAYS JAIL CREDIT IF REVOKED IN THE FUTURE.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to have no contact with the victim or her family.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  Defendant is to complete Batterers Treatment.  Defendant is to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: STAYED if defendant completes 40 hours of community service within the first year of probation.
To be completed within the first year of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Veenstra to Judge Damon
William Nemer for the State, def appeared in person with his attorney Joseph Veenstra.  Def enterd plea on counts 1, 2 and 3.  Court finds def G, Def sentenced..
from Atty Veenstra to Judge Damon
William Nemer for the State;; Both the Def and his atty, Joseph Veenstra appeared by phone.  PLEAS set.  Bond cont.

Pre-trial conference at 03-23-2015 10:00 am.
Status Conference at 04-16-2015 01:30 pm.

William Nemer for the State; Def appeared by phone.  Def's atty, Joseph Veenstra also appeared by phone.  Def wishes to waive right to PH.  Court advised Def of right to PH.  Def KVI waives right to PH.  Court finds probable cause felony committed.  Information filed.  Def wishes to waive appearance and proceed to arraignment.   Atty Veenstra states Def waives reading of Information and stands mute to charges.  Court enters NG pleas on Def's behalf.  PTC/STC set.  Bond cont.
from Atty Veenstra to Judge Damon.  Def may appear by phone for PH on 2/24/15.
Defendant to have no contact with the alleged victim, C.B..  Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol or enter taverns.

William Nemer for the State; Def appeared in custody by video from Tremp. Co. Jail.  Def's atty, Joseph Vienstra appeared by phone.  Def received copy of complaint and waives reading.  Court advised Def of rights.  Def KVI waives rights.  Court enters NG pleas on Def's behalf on misd. charges.  PH set.  Bond set.
